comments.commentBody: Yet to read an article that doesn't include new information on ways to get a good night's sleep.   I am lucky if I get 6 full hours.  But I do notice that if I wake up early, I fall back into a deeper sleep and wake up mid morning--but not as rested as I would like.   Getting to sleep has never been easy for me.  I've been tested twice and not found to have apnea.  But wonder if a CPAP machine works for insomnia.

Are you kidding?!!!

You are hacking the rest of the world, China Russia and Ecuador included, and you are angry they don't offer help?! OMG! Please, please don't feel angry. This is just the way they supposed to act.

You are wrong about plants transpiration since the globe is largely covered with ocean. You are wrong about the direct effect of temperature on evaporation; it is highly dependent upon winds at the ocean surface.

From studying Ray Pierrehumbert's "Principles of Planetary Climate" one discovers that a first approximation is that evaporation grows about as the square of the temperature increase. Noticed lots of places flooding around the world?

Finally energy -in remains greater than energy-out. Therefore the temperature of ocean+air continues to increase.
Well said.

Great comment, Charles.

All these distractions won't matter much when the economy collapses.

Just wanting to add to the hundreds and hundreds of comments that prove that people do care about this issue and, I hope, about the 4th Amendment to the Constitution. Yes, we fear terrorist acts, yes we want our government to protect us, but the last time I looked, we still had a Constitution that was still relevant.

This is the time when the United States citizen realizes that the ACLU has been fighting to protect constitutional rights for decades. Thank goodness they're there, reminding all of us of the most conservative position one could have: adherence to a document hundreds of years old, written to preserve our democracy for all time.

We can still be safe and free, but we all must speak up and demand that.

Hopefully Liverpool of Mexico will be present among prospective buyers for Saks. As mention above real estate is a key component in retail. While Liverpool does not currently separate it's real estate operations they are indeed quite profitable and quite extensive.

Indeed Liverpool is much more profitable than any of it's current North American peers.
Cannot wait or else starvation may well solve the population problem; work on both now.

Women are punished so severely in regards to their sexuality so much more than men. There are so many points of view in this particular case regarding who did what to whom, etc. But the fact remains that in all situations in life, if there is blame to be projected, it is most likely a woman that becomes the movie screen of shame. Women like sex just as much as men, and women make mistakes just as much as men and women misbehave on social media just like men. Beyond that, when is this puritanical country's citizens going to grow up and stop being so easily entertained by other people's sexual exploits? It's pathetic. It's also quite ironic, and metaphoric, that Weiner's wife works with Hilary Clinton who has been so discriminated in the press and treated very differently than men because of the continued fear and bashing of powerful women. In America, the madonna-whore thing continues to thrive with unrelenting toxicity. Women have to fight back against it in greater numbers. Own your brains, your sexuality, your power and stop letting bigots wreck your life with their nasty judgments!

hi - am i the only one commenting on the different numbering? in my version, the last clue was 109 A about 10 off the one with the answers. also, one of my starred answers was "smash" not the needed "tenam", so i never did get the needed "e" for teeth. but i am impressed with so many comments how easy it was - i thought it was REALLY difficult! guess, i have to go back to doing more work :-)
Just a reporting question here: How can the reporter write that only five women were involved, and in the same paragraph say that "some did X" and "some did Y". THERE WERE ONLY FIVE. what?

I am baffled by the seeming nonchalance of this article. This guy (Weiner) is a pervert who should be barred, permanently, from public office. The fact that he is taken seriously is a sign of how low we have sunk in this country.

Paul
Look, the guy's a good liberal. We need more like him. It's time to move on.

I agree, and think Dr Krugman's graphic would bring this point home if each of the curves was divided by the respective quintile's median income (in 2008 dollars) at the time. I'm guessing the bottom quintile result would still be more or less flat but higher than the top quintile; and the top quintile would be flat or downward sloping.

He's a sorry clone of a similar narcissist and betrayer of his friends which we have her in CA-- Gavin Newsom, who also won't go away.

Sending photos of one's genitals to strangers is far from "childish." There are many ways to describe that pathology, but "childish" isn't in the mix. And laughing is not a reaction I'd expect any girl or woman to have, upon receipt of an uninvited photo of a stranger's junk.

One shocking aspect of his pathology is that, apparently, nobody reported him to law enforcement. Isn't it a crime to send porn? Don't try to spin that pics of his naked genitals are not porn, especially if sent to anybody other than his wife. One very pathological dude.
Viad, Clinton had and has far greater intelligence and charm and his ambition was carefully packaged. Weiner's ambition was (as a House member and presently) is not very aesthetic pronounced.

Re: physicians, scientists and engineers:
Not everyone can be an English major. My physician and engineer offspring completed their prerequisite courses in humanities. They were as serious students in these courses as they were in their professional preparation courses. But after completion they must necessarily move on in their preparation for their working professions. We have tried to encourage them to regard their humanities courses as introduction to a life's journey of reading and cultural enrichment, as much as they are able to support a cultural life while making a living at their professions and supporting their families. They have been introduced, but the journey is their responsibility.

To paraphrase John Belushi in "Animal House", having succeeded in my goal of becoming a physician, I let ten years of college go down the drain. Shame on me but shame on you all a little bit for wanting professionals in your lives whose training is so skewed. To have a decent perspective on what and where we are, it would be helpful to know why and how we got here. In those ten years of training to be a physician, I was allowed one elective. I took psychology. What a maroon!

We have failed to make English (a very poorly named subject, by the way) accepted as the most important thing we study. I know because it happened in my lifetime. I don't know if we need more English majors but if we do need more technocrats and engineers we could certainly have literate ones. Every physician, scientist and engineer would be more insightful, creative and effective with training in literature, philosophy , history and political science. Make the humanities part of the core curriculum for all college students and make us all better humans in the process.

Is this really a problem. What he and consenting adults did of their own free will is none of my business, Seems like all the problems she had was with busybody s  with no standing. That fact that they went public was not in anyone's best interests.

"Shame on the New York Times for letting personal mistakes come before the issues."
I agree. The issue should be why we should trust a politician who told barefaced lies, over and over, to the public for days on end. How can you trust someone like that?
THat's what right wingers would like us to believe.
Surely you jest! Are we to feel sorry for this person?

Bravo, Chris.  I completely agree.  We are surrounded by salacious media leeches and judgmental, moralizing low-lifes, all eager to cast blame and hurt others for, as you say, their own aggrandizement.  These bottom feeders keep this story roiling for  the few pennies they may scrounge up, or in some cases, just for the vengeful, sadistic glee of it.  But their foul karma will eventually be their inglorious downfalls.

Just the fact that the NYT allocates space for the Weiner pervert sends a very bad message to all women who are harassed by these fat cat politicians because guys like Weiner and Clinton get off on this stuff.
